executive_summary: Climbing gyms have enjoyed modest growth over the current period but have endured considerable volatility. Following the outbreak of COVID-19, social distancing measures and temporary closures led to massive revenue declines. Nonetheless, the number of climbing gyms increased by 44 in 2020, with only 18 permanently closing, according to 2021 data from the Climbing Business Journal. Pent-up demand led to a massive recovery for climbing gyms in 2021 as gyms reopened, even amid reduced capacities. The introduction of climbing at the Olympics led to an uptick in interest in climbing, greatly benefitting the recovery of climbing gyms. The number of new visitors has increased over the current period, propping up growth. Revenue has been increasing at a CAGR of 0.7% to total an estimated $580.1 million in 2024, including an estimated increase of 0.7% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of COVID-19 Hammered Climbing Gyms
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of COVID-19 led to considerable declines in climbing gyms, which were considered nonessential and closed for most of 2020. Many climbers began building and using home walls amid closures. Even as gyms reopened, many consumers continued using home walls to avoid the virus, preventing some recovery for gyms operating at reduced capacities.

Climbing gyms have enjoyed recent growth in their customer base, which many are crediting to climbing making its debut at the Olympics. The inclusion of bouldering at the Olympics has contributed to strong growth in the number of bouldering gyms in recent years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: GROWTH TO ACCELERATE OVER THE OUTLOOK
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Strong growth in total recreation spending over the outlook period will bolster the performance of climbing gyms. Participation in sports continuing to rise will also benefit climbing gyms.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE NUMBER OF EXPANSION GYMS TO CONTINUE CLIMBING
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the number of new first-location gyms has continued to outpace expansion gyms in recent years, various gym developers have been increasingly opening expansion gyms, with the Bouldering Project opening four new gyms in 2022 alone.

industry_definition: Climbing gyms provide consumers artificial rock walls. Climbing gyms consist of bouldering gyms, rope gyms or mixed gyms, consisting of both bouldering and rope climbing.

strengths: High Performance Drivers: Total recreation expenditure

key_trends: Climbing gyms have endured considerable volatility. The outbreak of COVID-19 led to massive declines for climbing gyms. Pent-up demand and new interest in climbing as the sport debuted at the Olympics enabled climbing gyms to recover from pandemic-induced declines.

Climbing gyms will continue to enjoy growth. Rising recreation expenditure and sports participation will benefit climbing gyms. Still, an acceleration of expansion gyms opening will increase competition.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Younger consumers in this age group are employed and have disposable income levels to attend climbing gyms for recreation and the social aspects of climbing gyms. Also, these consumers look to climbing as exercise and take training seriously as they look to compete. Older consumers in this age group attend various gyms targeted to this audience. These consumers attend family-friendly gyms with their children, while at the same time, long-time climbers attend gyms catered to experienced climbers.

Individuals in this market have greater free time than older demographics with families, driving up expenditure at climbing gyms. Also, the rise of competitive climbing in recent years, with climbing making its debut at the most recent summer Olympics, has spurred growth in this market.

This market comprises children aged 17 and under attending climbing gyms. Sports activity from most consumers in this market typically comes from other sports and they don't tend to attend climbing gyms as much as older demographics. Also, parents typically pay for services for this market, contributing to lower expenditure.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment comprises bouldering gyms. Bouldering is done without a rope and uses a crash pad to break landings.
This segment comprises rope and mixed climbing gyms. Rope climbing consists of wall climbing with a rope and climbing gear. Mixed gyms consist of rope climbing and bouldering wall climbing.

tier_1_suppliers: Athletic & Sporting Goods Manufacturing in the US
Gym & Exercise Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Sporting Goods Stores in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The content mentions that climbing gyms face moderate to increasing competition. It lists the following as substitutes or competitors for climbing gyms: outdoor rock climbing, outdoor bouldering, home walls, fitness classes, gymnastics, other sports.

basis_points.basis_description: The content mentions that climbing gyms face moderate to increasing competition. It lists the following as substitutes or competitors for climbing gyms: - Outdoor rock climbing - Outdoor bouldering - Home walls - Fitness classes - Gymnastics - Other sports

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: HIGH SERVICE STANDARDS PUSHED UP WAGE COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Climbing gyms rely on knowledgeable employees like route setters and climbing instructors who can share technical knowledge and advice with climbers and ensure safety standards.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Increases in the number of climbing gyms over the current period
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: have led to a large increase in the number of employees and wages over the current period. Many climbing gyms opening over the current period have increased competition for knowledgeable employees, forcing gyms to hike wages to attract and retain workers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served my incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Total Recreation Spending has Induced Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Given that climbing is considered a form of recreation, total recreation spending impacts volatility. Total recreation spending plummeted following the outbreak of COVID-19, contributing to massive declines in 2020.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: THE NUMBER OF NEW BOULDERING GYMS IS GROWING RAPIDLY
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment comprises bouldering gyms. Bouldering is done without a rope and uses a crash pad to break landings.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: According to the Climbing Business Journal's Gyms and Trends 2022 report
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: From 2013-2022, 50.0% of new climbing gyms were bouldering gyms compared to new mixed and new rope.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Rope and Mixed Climbing Gyms Comprise the Largest Product Offering
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment comprises rope and mixed climbing gyms. Rope climbing consists of wall climbing with a rope and climbing gear. Mixed gyms consist of rope climbing and bouldering wall climbing.

FAQs.question: What are the key questions for owners regarding regulation and policy?
FAQs.answer: The key questions are: 1) Low regulation, 2) Steady regulation

FAQs.question: What are the key questions for owners regarding industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The key questions are: 1) Low assistance, 2) Steady assistance
